definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different

sentences.english: Next, must display sincerely, avoids speaking insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要表現出真誠，避免言不由衷。

sentences.english: There has been a great deal of politician's cant .
sentences.chinese: 說了一大堆政客慣用的言不由衷的話。

sentences.english: They love National Geographic Magazine unfeignedly and regard it as museum piece.
sentences.chinese: 他們由衷地喜愛《華夏地理》雜誌，視爲珍藏。

sentences.english: But another group of working people love their work unfeignedly.
sentences.chinese: 但是，另外一些工作的人由衷地喜愛工作。

sentences.english: He and I are ambiguous between the insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 我和他之間的曖昧都是言不由衷。

sentences.english: Australia's development and progress, I am sincerely pleased.
sentences.chinese: 對澳大利亞的發展和進步，我感到由衷欣慰。

sentences.english: Denmark welcomes and applauds the success of China.
sentences.chinese: 丹麥爲中國的成就感到由衷的高興。

sentences.english: We would admire both his earnestness and his self-aware irony.
sentences.chinese: 我們由衷地欽佩他的認真和有自知之明的諷刺藝術。

sentences.english: You are really a knowledgeable mentor and have great teaching skills.
sentences.chinese: 在您的指導下學到了很多，我由衷感謝您。

sentences.english: loved by the king and the queen from their heart.
sentences.chinese: 國王和王后都給予了他由衷的愛。

sentences.english: He was mouthing the usual platitudes about the need for more compassion .
sentences.chinese: 他言不由衷地說些需要更加同情之類的陳腔濫調。

sentences.english: Gradually a sense of the insincerity in her words began to bother her.
sentences.chinese: 逐漸地她的文字中的一絲言不由衷開始令她困擾。

sentences.english: At the end of her visiting, she hoped the school have its new campus and become better.
sentences.chinese: 她由衷希望華光女高越辦越好，期望新校早日建成。

sentences.english: Finally, thanks for your review and comment.
sentences.chinese: 最後由衷感謝您的評論與指教。

sentences.english: My sincere thanks to you for being my child's teacher.
sentences.chinese: 由衷感謝您，我孩子尊敬的老師。

definition: to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to exhibit one's feelings in one's speech
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
